citation.article-title: Clostridium methylpentosum sp. nov.: a ring-shaped intestinal bacterium that ferments only methylpentoses and pentoses.

p.s: Description of Clostridium methylpentosum sp. nov.
Clostridium methylpentosum (me'.thyl.pen.to'.sum. M.L. neut. adj. methylpentosum, pertaining to methylpentose)
Cells are rods (0.3 x 2.0 μm) bent in the shape of rings, with the ends of the rods usually overlapping.
Cells grow singly or forming left-handed helical chains (coils), most chains consisting of 3 to 4 cells and longer chains consisting of up to 50 cells.
Gram-positive, non-motile.
Endospores distend the cell, are spherical to oval and terminally located.
Endospores are formed on plates of Sweet E agar medium (Holdeman et al. 1977) supplemented with L-rhamnose.
Large capsules are present.
Surface colonies on L-rhamnose agar medium are white, circular, convex, opaque, smooth, mucoid, and measure 1 to 2 mm in diameter after 48 h at 37°C.
Obligate anaerobe.
Optimum growth rate and highest final cell densities are at 45°C.
No growth at 25°C or 50°C.
At 37°C with L-rhamnose as the fermentable substrate, growth yields are 4 x 108 colony-forming units per ml and the population doubling time is 1.2 h.
Cultures in L-rhamnose broth have a pH of 4.5-5.0 after incubation for 16 h at 37°C
Chemoorganotrophic.
Does not carry out dissimilatory sulfate reduction.
Only L-rhamnose, L-fucose, L-lyxose, and D-arabinose are used as fermentable substrates for growth, among many compounds that were tested.

Does not utilize as fermentable substrates for growth: N-acetylglucosamine, amino acids, L-arabitol, L-arabinose, L-ascorbate, cellobiose, D-fructose, fucoidan, D-fucose, D-galactose, D-galacturonate, D-gluconate, D-glucosamine, D-glucose, 2-deoxy-D-glucose, D-glucuronate, glycerol, lactate, lactose, D-lyxose, maltose, mannitol, D-mannose, pectin, polygalacturonate, 1,2-propanediol, pyruvate, raffinose, L-sorbose, starch, sucrose, D-xytose, and L-xylose.
Exogenous biotin, vitamin B12 and bicarbonate are required for growth.
Exogenous folic acid and riboflavin are stimulatory for growth.
Grows in 20% bile.
Growing cells ferment L-rhamnose or L-fucose forming propionate, n-propanol, acetate, CO2 and H2 as end products.
Acetate, glycolaldehyde, CO2, and H2 are end products of L-lyxose or D-arabinose fermentation.
Isolated from human feces.
The mol% guanine + cytosine of the DNA is 46 (thermal denaturation).
Type strain: R2; deposited with the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC strain number 43829).
Inasmuch as the description of the species is based on a single strain (the type strain), the description of the type strain is the same as that given above for the species.
